locations.name: Helgen
locations.description: You are at Helgen, a moderately-sized community near Skyrim's South border.

locations.name: Falkreath
locations.description: You are at Falkreath, a major city famous for its large graveyard.

locations.name: Riverwood
locations.description: You arrive at Riverwood. It is a small village in a valley, between a river and a steep mountainside.

locations.name: Ivarstead
locations.description: You ar at Ivarstead. There is nothing here.

locations.name: Lake Geir
locations.description: You are at the banks alongside Lake Geir. You see an island sitting in the center.

locations.name: Riften
locations.description: You are at Riften, a large city bisected by a large canal, with a good portion of the city spilling over the water atop large, wooden, piers.

locations.name: Eastmarch
locations.description: You are at Eastmarch, a volcanically active area with steaming gas leaking in between cracks in the ground.

locations.name: Windhelm
locations.description: You have arrived at Windhelm, the City of Kings.

locations.name: Winterhold
locations.description: You are at Winterhold. Once a great capital, it is now a shell of its former self due to the Great Collapse.

locations.name: Dawnstar
locations.description: You are at Dawnstar, a relatively small town. It resides in perpetual snow and ice.

locations.name: Morthal
locations.description: You are at Morthal, a city with a small population and relatively remote location.

locations.name: Solitude
locations.description: You have arrived at Solitude, the capital city of Skyrim and headquarters of the Imperial Legion.

locations.name: Rorikstead
locations.description: You are at Rorikstead, a settlement consisting of two cottages, an inn, and a manor.

locations.name: Markarth
locations.description: You are at Markarth. There is a local saying, "Blood and silver are what flows through Markarth..."

locations.name: Whiterun
locations.description: You are at Whiterun. Its central location makes it the commercial heart of Skyrim.
